intro: Lasianthus strigosus var. chinensis, commonly known as Chinese hairy hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and have a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs. The flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central column.
